ALLEGATION:
Facility has not submitted records to MDHHS for permanent retention one year
following the final order of adoption as required. There are 8 records that have
not been submitted.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the Program Director of foster care and adoption. He reported there
were eight files that were not sent to the local offices. He reported
two adoption files were submitted to Macomb County DHHS on 6/2/2022. One
adoption file was sent to Oakland County DHHS office on 6/2/2022, two adoptions
files were sent to North Central DHHS office on 6/2/2022 and three adoption files
2

were sent to Western Wayne DHHS on 6/10/2022.
The Program Director reported these adoption files were not submitted timely
because he was uninformed of the actual process of submitting the files and that he
takes full responsibility for not knowing who to contact. He said he was unaware of
which offices were operational during the time the files were due because of the
pandemic. He said some offices were only open on certain days and some were
closed. He also reported that now the agency knows the process and moving
forward files will be delivered on time.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12713 Adoption placement record.
(5) The Michigan department of human services must
permanently retain all adoption records for children
adopted from Michigan's child welfare system. The
adoption agency must forward any adoption records for
children adopted from the Michigan child welfare system to
the department one year after finalization of the adoption.
The adoption agency may not retain the original copies or
any other copies of the adoption records.
ANALYSIS:
The Facility has not submitted records to MDHHS for permanent
retention one year following the final order of adoption as
required. There were 8 records that have not been submitted
timely to the local DHHS offices. Therefore, this agency is in
violation with the rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
